intro: Ophiorhipsalis lumbricoides subsp. aculeata, commonly known as the curly spider plant, is a compact, trailing succulent native to South Africa. It features fleshy, dark green leaves that are often curled or twisted, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters during the growing season. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil with bright, indirect light. Its slow growth and decorative foliage make it a popular choice for hanging baskets and indoor gardens.
